content:
Diagnosis:		Left breast cancer - mixed ductal/lobular carcinoma

Management:		Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy March 2024

Histology:		pT1c (18mm) N1mi (0.9mm deposit) M0
			Grade 3 mixed ductal/lobular carcinoma
			ER/PR/HER2 negative
			BRCA2 mutation not detected

Current Situation:	Pre-cycle 3 adjuvant EC chemotherapy

[redacted name] attended the breast oncology clinic today for assessment prior to cycle 3 EC chemotherapy. She has tolerated the first two cycles reasonably well with only grade 1 nausea and mild fatigue. Her main side effect has been complete alopecia which she was prepared for. No febrile episodes. Performance status remains 0. Blood results today show neutrophils 2.8, platelets 156, and normal liver function. Examination shows good healing of the breast wound with no concerning features. She is keen to proceed with the next cycle. I am happy for her to continue with cycle 3 EC today as planned. We will see her again before cycle 4.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: ER negative, PR negative, HER2 negative, BRCA2 mutation not detected

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy
Blood results show neutrophils 2.8, platelets 156, normal liver function

patient_facts.value: Good healing of breast wound with no concerning features

status_updates.value: Early breast cancer post surgery, receiving adjuvant EC chemotherapy. Tolerating treatment well with minimal side effects
Grade 1 nausea, mild fatigue, complete alopecia
Proceeding with cycle 3 EC chemotherapy as planned
